intro: Sorocea houllettiana, commonly known as Houllett's sorocea, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and swampy areas. It has small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
